snippet: A judge struck down a part of a state law that keeps details about the drugs used in executions secret, saying that drug suppliers do not have a constitutional right to be free from criticism.
abstract: Arkansas Judge Wendell Griffen strikes down part of state law that keeps details about drugs used in executions secret.
lead_paragraph: A judge struck down a part of a state law that keeps details about the drugs used in executions secret, saying that drug suppliers do not have a constitutional right to be free from criticism.
